result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Lee King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  To be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Department is to access for vocational needs and relevant programming.  Defendant to follow through with any recommendations.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users/dealers, or drug houses.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in a cognitive thinking program.
Restitution set at zero.
Obtain AODA assessment.  Successfully complete follow up treatment. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already provided, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as  convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Lee King

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
As to Count 1 as amended: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Richard Lee King in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Richard Lee King in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Robbery (Threat of Force), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(b) and 939.50(3)(e), a Class E Felony.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review offer with the defendant; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have NO CONTACT with Calvena S. and Lena's Food Market.
TOT Justice Point and ALL other bail terms and conditions REMAIN.

Defendant Richard Lee King in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Richard Lee King in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.   Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  The Court modifies(lowers) bail to $1750.00 CASH; SAME TERMS.  Defense request time to review discovery materials.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Bail bond hearing and Scheduling conference.  Hearing proceeded.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays hearing.  Bail argument made by state and defense.  State submits no-contact order.  Defense objects as the defendant is not present for service.  Case passed to 1:30 p.m.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Scheduling conference.  Defense requests to be heard on bail.  Case not scheduled for bail motion as defense filed notice of motion in clerk of courts office instead of Branch 21.  Court unable to hear bail motion at this time due to calendar/time restraints.  Defense request to address bail on tomorrow granted.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
FILED, NOTION OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR REDUCTION OF BAIL
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Richard Lee King in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Richard Lee King in custoday. Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and the Court entered a plea of not guilty on the Defendant's behalf.  Case reassigned to Judge Brash in Branch 21 as it was inappropriately tabbed. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
FILED, NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard Lee King in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Richard Lee King in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  PRELIMINARY HEARING SET AT REQUEST OF ADA.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
